snippet: Mitt Romney blamed the president’s policies for increases in energy costs, but in his 2010 book, the former governor wrote that such changes might benefit the economy.
abstract: Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney blames Pres Obama's policies for the rising cost of gasoline, but in his 2010 book No Apology, the former governor had written that increasing energy costs might benefit the American economy.
lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney blamed the president’s policies for increases in energy costs, but in his 2010 book, the former governor wrote that such changes might benefit the economy.

headline.seo: Romney Faults Obama for Rising Gas Prices
headline.main: Romney Faults Obama on Energy Costs, but Has Cited Benefits of Rising Prices
headline.print_headline: Romney Cites Obama’s Energy Policy in Rise of Nation’s Gas Prices
